ptdb.kernel.bl.search

Class GraphSearcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptdb.kernel.bl.search.AbstractSearcher
      • ptdb.kernel.bl.search.GraphSearcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResultHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PatternMatchGraphSearcher, XQueryGraphSearcher

    public abstract class GraphSearcher
extends AbstractSearcher
    Inherits from the AbstractSearcher, and contains the common functions for the searchers for graph pattern match search.
    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Alek Wang
    Accepted Rating:
    red (wenjiaow)
    Proposed Rating:
    red (wenjiaow)

    • Method Detail

      • getGraphSearcher

        public static java.util.ArrayList<GraphSearcher> getGraphSearcher(SearchCriteria searchCriteria)
        A factory which returns the concrete GraphSearcher objects according to the complexity of the search criteria from the user.

        Different graph searcher has different capability to perform the graph pattern match search. The original design is that this factory method will return the appropriate searchers according to the given graph pattern search criteria.

        For now, due to the limitation of searching patterns in the database, this factory will anyway construct both XQueryGraphSearcher and PatternMatchGraphSearcher, and return both of them in a list. The first searcher in the list will be the instance of the XQueryGraphSearcher, and the second will be PatternMatchGraphSearcher.

        Parameters:
        searchCriteria - The search criteria input by the user.
        Returns:
        The list that contains the required graph searchers, created according to the search criteria. The searchers in the returned list should be used in their order in the list.

      • _isSearchCriteriaSet

        protected boolean _isSearchCriteriaSet()
        Checks whether the graph search criteria has been set in this graph searcher instance.
        Specified by:
        _isSearchCriteriaSet in class AbstractSearcher
        Returns:
        true - if the search criteria has been set.
        false - if the search criteria has not been set.
